        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>lesson plan</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>teacher</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">16-19</string>
            <string language="en">16-19</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Objective: to extend students’ knowledge gained In lower classes about seismic phenomena in the world: the main causes and effects of earthquakes, their occurrence and size.

To introduce the subject, the teacher reminds students what group of phenomena the seismic phenomena belong to, indicates the link of  seismic phenomena with volcanic activity and the movement of tectonic plates. Making use of a calibrate learning resource students try to recall a definition of earthquakes and measuring instruments –seismographs.

In a form of presentation, using a calibrate learning resource, the teacher along with students analyze the areas of high seismic activity in the chosen parts of the world.

Students carry out a simulation of earthquakes of different force. (calibrate learning resource )

To sum up the lesson, students show on the map the areas most frequently affected by earthquakes and indicate their link with other geological processes.
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
